Subbu Allamaraju wrote:
> Bill,
> 
>     You (and others) really have to stop using this "the www is real and it
>     works" to answer every difficulty that application developers come
>     across when trying to apply a RESTful architecture to their problem
>     domain.  Its just totally unproductive.  The fact of the matter is the
>     vast majority of the Web is a one-to-one relationship between client and
>     server.  In other words, the Web is a simple system.  As a result you
>     have a lot of simple answers to simple problems.  These integration
>     problems are real and I think REST can solve many of them in a
>     better way.
> 
> 
> Almost all of the real web is based on a one-to-many relationship.'

For reading data sure, certainly not for coordinating input and output.
